text: Hello Newbie here, I wanted to ask if there is an easy way to provide the pagination in the blog post detail view with a preview image for the next/previous post?
yep, there are variables for next and previous posts available in blog templates see here <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-variables#blog-variables>
<@UM4EYDDAS> what text editor are you using?
Pycharm and its console. But I'm seeing to change it for VSC for HubSpot dev.

Hey Sylvain, just a quick update. The team is working on a fix for image gallery module. As a workaround, if you clone the first slide then go in and edit it, you will be able to add images.

Also, the image gallery module works as intended from a page perspective, it seems the design manager is the only place where this should be happening. Ill continue to keep you updated but please feel free to use the workaround above in the meantime.

If you have any questions please let me know.
<@U6W3H6YN8> I've just tried with VSC and Pycharm. With VCS, when I save the file, I don't have this error. But I've got it with Pycharm.
Thank you, we are looking into that issue

I confirm: it works if I clone the first slide and edit it. :slightly_smiling_face: Thanks. I've noted that it happens only if we want to define default slides in the design manager. Congratulations to all: you are doing a very good job with this plateform. I am discovering it each day and it's very powerful...

Thanks :slightly_smiling_face: Ill keep you posted once a fix for the image gallery is in place so you dont have to worry about the issue anymore from the Design Manager point of view. If you have any other questions, comments, or concerns, please don’t hesitate to reach out to us through support or here in the slack, we always love talking with fellow devs :slightly_smiling_face:

Hello. Basic question I guess. I wanted to use a template pack from the Marketplace to help speed up development. Once I have the templates, modules, coded files, etc., do I just edit them as is? Can I rename them for the specific project? Do I clone them first? I’ve always started my templates from scratch before. Thanks!
I would clone everything to another folder
Great, thanks! That’s what I thought made sense. It’d be great if HubSpot automated that somehow to make it easier.
